column4: Hey, everyone.  I was wondering, is there a way to play .rm files in ubuntu?  vlc and mplayer aren't agreeing.
Oh man.  I guess I have to.  *sigh*
helixplayer works?
i tried to use helixplayer, no luck
standard players dont offer to install the plugins for you?
hmm, would you have an url for testing?
I'm not sujre what you mean.
ok, my mistake. one step back. what is the message when it "doesnt find the plugins"?
There is no matching application available.
you were using synaptic. could be a problem with the repositories (database where all the software is stored)
which version of ubuntu are you using?
which version of ubuntu are you using?
could you also give me the internet address of the rm you are trying to play?
http://www.mininova.org/get/1256224
hold on for a few minutes. i am just installing 7.10 into a virtual machine
needs to be done anyway..
i am just downloading the updates. 15 more minutes.. and the also the rm. stay tuned! ;-)
thank you!
confirmed
let me just test in hardy
what's confirmed?
the error message you gave on 7.1
I am going to ask my pet linux nerd next week; until then, I will stick with the bigger .avi files
